I make separate meals for me and my kids...because I don't think my kids would like to eat Keto Chow every night for dinner. Haha. (Nor could I afford them to!)
Best post in the thread.

I certainly wouldn't call 9 net carbs per serving Low-Carb!
I guess some might though.

Yup, the .5g sugar labeling can be used against us too.
Biggest perpetrator? Tic tacs! A tic tac is basically pure sugar. A single tic tac is .5g - .49g of which is sugar. So the [standard] container of 40 servings (each tic tac is 1 serving) lists it as having 0 sugar...when in fact, there is 19.6 grams of sugar in the whole package! Very deceptive.
You have to be wary of things with very small serving sizes.
KCKO!

In the end, the best diet isn't really a diet at all. It's a way of eating you can stick to that will boost your overall health.
This so much! The whole article tries to get summed up by saying keto is a diet that is just like any other diet, but is restrictive.
To ME, it's a diet (way of life) that is easy, takes very little thought, and gives me more time to do other things in life because I'm not constantly thinking about food or how hungry I am.
That sounds great, and very affordable! I wish I had one of those nearby me.

I had a minor breakthrough the other day when I realized at the end of the day...I'd not reached my caloric goals yet, but I wasn't hungry at all! I actually had to force myself to eat some stuff in order to make my calorie/macro goals. It kind of helped me realize how wonderful keto is for controlling cravings/hunger.
In my opinion, that's an awful lot of carbs for a little food. =(
I think many people that "try" keto but that didn't research it enough don't understand how easy it is to go over the carb limit and not be in ketosis.
And what meal is that?

Just like Jedi stated. I (personally) am doing keto not because it's the road to weight lose....CICO is what weight loss is all about...but because keto lets me not be hungry all day long! And not being hungry means it's SUPER easy to meet my CICO goals.
The fact that I get to eat liberal amounts of bacon, eggs and steak is just icing on the cake for me.
The comments in imgur comments always crack me up, when people talk about it not being healthy with all the butter, fat etc. Don't listen to them (obviously)

[speaking strictly keto] If you're not worried about your budget....
Two hard boiled eggs, and an entire 8 oz package of sliced roast beef. It clocks in at close to 400 calories, with zero carbs.

WRITING.TITLE: [FP] Wendy's Baconator with no Bun or Sauce
WRITING.TEXT:
Coworker was going out to get food earlier today for lunch, and I asked her to stop by Wendy's and get one for me, not knowing what to expect.
The price was a little more than I expected, but Mmmmmm, was SO GOOD.
http://imgur.com/gallery/3r8CM
Let me know what you think?! My mouth has been watering thinking about having it again ever since I wrote that, haha.

(On a lark) I bought a tin of Bumblebee Smoked Trout (boneless/skinless), to see what that was about. Oh.my.God.
That was one of the most delicious things I've had in a LONG time. It was like gourmet Tuna. So tasty it felt like it was melting in my mouth...and it was drenched in the oils we need.
It's a little bit pricey, but do yourself a favor and try it once. It was simply amazing!
Pretty sure they were making a sarcastic joke. =)
My point exactly. To us, a cow dying to make a burger means nothing. To "them", us dying to make room for an intergalactic rest stop might mean nothing.

I don't buy that at all. I just smooshed an ant crawling on my desk, and I didn't give one thought to the idea that I was deleting a consciousness. Same with the burger I ate for dinner. A consciousness was obliterated so I could raise my cholesterol level. Meh.
We're not special snowflakes. We can expect no special treatment from another "intelligent" being.

Whoa, it just clicked due to your reply, thank you!
I totally get it. You subtract the fiber carbs from the total carbs, because they don't count at all due to non-digestion, not because they are "cancelling out" other carbs.

WRITING.TITLE: [Science] Question about Net Carbs (Negative Carbs?)
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all, brand new to the scene, and started my keto journey only about a week ago. Going fantastic already, it's almost...too easy...at how this is working.
Anyhow, I see that the "formula" to calculate how many carbs you are counting is the total carbs minus the carbs from fiber.
My question is, if you eat something with...say, 5 carbs of Fiber, and no other carbs...would/could that be considered negative 5 carbs? i.e. That 5 carbs of fiber could negate something else I ate with 5 carbs of sugar....
Just a thought that came into my head while browsing the forums...I look forward to reading how my thought process is wrong, haha.

WRITING.TEXT:

His dedication to the book currently, seems to be...not very high...so we'll see if a 70+ year old man (when it's time to write the last book) in not the best of health still thinks that spending another half decade writing something that he seemingly has no passion for really happens.

The law is that the merging vehicle has to give the right of way. He very obviously broke the law by taking the right of way.

The officer took the statement from him first, yes, and then he came over to me and once I said I have footage of it, he seemed really happy. He watched the footage three times, asked if I had anything to add...I said no, the footage is my statement, and that was all there was. His Insurance Company later asked for a copy of the footage also when I filed through them citing the police report, they had no problem reimbursing me.
All animals/insects with a CNS have a period of dormancy/inactivity that can be considered sleep.
If I see ya at the bar, I owe ya a beer. ;)

Yeah. We should definitely just go by his convictions and what he has said in interviews. After all, he said in interviews we'd have WoW by now.
/s

About a year ago, I had a very aggressive driver trying to get into the mainline highway from an entry ramp, but traffic was at a crawl. The mainline was letting people from the entry zipper into the flow no problem, but this guy was making it very clear that he wanted to get in front of me even though I was making it very clear that I already let someone in, and he could merge in behind me.
He inched closer, and closer and closer to my front, trying to make me get off the butt of the car in front of me, so he could fit in, but I wouldn't slow down.
Sure enough, he must have said "f it", and he just turned right into my front quarter.
He tried to tell the police that I accelerated into him (not that he just turned into me while we were doing 2 mph).
If he was smart, he would have noticed I have a dash cam and it caught the entire thing as he swerved into me. The police report was written not in his favor once I showed them the video, and the insurance determined 100% his fault.
I was late, but it was almost worth it.
*TL:DR - Get a Dash Cam. If everyone had one, less people would be jerks on the road.

Good correction on your part about my leaving in the decimal, but it would be a 555 followed by 34 zeros, not 36. (as you no doubt know, the two fives count as two of the 36)
While I disagree with the way you said it, I agree with what you said. Have an up.

The scale on the (second to) last info graph is horribly skewed. It makes it look like we're halfway to the end of the Universe.
You want to put Time in Perspective? Do it right!
If all 13.8 Billion years of the Universe's existence was represented by ONLY 1 MILLIMETER on the left side of a line chart, and the right side was the future of time going up to where only black holes exists (10^76 years)....the chart would look like this.
1 millimeter (on the left side) - 7.66 x 10^46 LIGHT YEARS (on the right side)
Lets put that into further perspective. Light has had 13.8 Billion years to travel. So. Our little infographic line chart would have the current age of the Universe as 1 millimeter on the left...and the right side would be the distance light has traveled since the birth of the Universe TIMES 5.55 x 10^36. That's a 5.55 followed by 34 zeros...times the distance light has traveled since the universe was born. Compared to 1 millimeter.
Our minds can't even grasp a ratio that incomprehensible.
And, that's only until there are only black holes left. For the actual heat death of the universe, add 44 or so more zeros up there.
*edit Wording
*Second edit. I did in fact miss it saying 10^10^76 ...so, my numbers I have above are brain melting-ly small compared to the actual numbers.

^^ This so much.
When I was in, we ALWAYS had heritage and tradition brought to our attention, and were hammered with how important it was is. Ask any Navy Chief what heritage and tradition means to them. It's not just important, it's literally the culture our Navy is built on and thrives on.
This is such a horrible idea.
And YES on HuMAN....MANkind...it doesn't exclude women, it includes them. Hell, if they had their way, they'd get rid of the word WoMAN.
I watched the live-stream of the CNO speaking to an auditorium of random Sailors in Norfolk about this new policy. A Sailor asked why they kept the term "Seaman" and got rid of the other terms because of gender equality....the CNO and the MCPON had the nerve to say "For Tradition". FFFFFUUUUUU CNO. Also very telling, a female Sailor asked a question and made a sort of joke about not being able to call her Boats anymore (nickname for a Boatswain's Mate) because she isn't a BM anymore...and the entire crowd erupted into applause at her concern at that. That just showed that pretty much 100% of the Sailors in the audience thought it was a stupid idea as well to take this path.

I don't agree with your opinion that it's the employees brunt to bear. He's the Chief, he takes the responsibility, even if it was the employee's fault. That's just the way things work.
However, I do agree with you that it probably happens all the time in the industry. Wells Fargo just was unlucky enough to be caught first.
Nice try Russia.

I just scrolled though hundreds upon hundreds of comments on this, and there was literally only one response that was for this change.
Public opinion is definitely against it.
Name checks out

This is pretty crazy. If you read the actual NAVADMIN that went out to the entire Navy today, the title changes are in effect immediately. As in, even though everyone still has their ratings they've always had, now you have to awkwardly say "Hey, Petty Officer First Class, take a look at this." Instead of "Hey MM1, take a look at this."
You can apparently still just call them Petty Officer. But, you know who calls someone "Petty Officer Smith"? Someone that's trying to be a dick, that's who.
*edit* For those not in the know for Navy culture...calling someone Petty Officer Smith, instead of MM1.....is the equivalent of instead of calling Bob Smith by his first name when you talked to him [Good morning Bob, What's for lunch Bob]....you called him Mr. Smith ONLY, all the time [Good morning Mr. Smith, What's for lunch Mr. Smith]
